definition: to take seriously (often with negative expression: "don't take it too seriously")/to treat conscientiously
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
(onom.) dong/ding dong (bell)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
to curve/to return/to revolve
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
variant of 迴|回[hui2]
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]
erhua variant of 當回事|当回事[dang4 hui2 shi4]

sentences.english: It seems that he's just not taking this issue seriously.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去似乎没把这问题当回事。

sentences.english: She took everything for granted after the fashion of wealthy and pampered girls.
sentences.chinese: 她也像那些被宠坏的富家女一样把什么都不当回事。

sentences.english: She's plain doormat, for even every member of her family would treat her like dirt.
sentences.chinese: 她简直就是个出气筒，连家里人都不把她当回事。

sentences.english: Until recently, few people took the saying very seriously.
sentences.chinese: 以前，人们都没把这句谚语当回事。

sentences.english: I sincerely hope that you can take my letter seriously.
sentences.chinese: 我真诚地希望您能把我的信当回事。

sentences.english: I don't get down to Vermillion much since your mother died.
sentences.chinese: 自打你妈妈去世后我就没把维尔米林那边的事当回事。

sentences.english: Maybe, but don't count on it anytime soon. And don't count on it mattering.
sentences.chinese: 可能会，但是别指望立马能实现，也别把这太当回事。

sentences.english: “These gangs don’t recognise the authority of the police, ” he said.
sentences.chinese: “这伙暴徒不把警察的权威当回事，”他说。

sentences.english: No one took him seriously, people just laughed at him.
sentences.chinese: 但没人把他当回事，人们只是嘲笑他。

sentences.english: He turns a deaf ear to what the boss says, never taking it seriously.
sentences.chinese: 他对老板的话置若罔闻，根原不把它当回事。

sentences.english: This is because men have an incorrigible habit of taking fellow drivers for granted.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为男人们打心眼里就没把别的司机们当回事。

sentences.english: Had I no regard for them?
I suggest you to take him seriously.
sentences.chinese: 我建议你要把他当回事。

sentences.english: THE well-to-do in China have snubbed their government.
sentences.chinese: 中国的高收入者这回没把政府当回事。

sentences.english: Stop disrespecting the guitar by wearing it as a fashion accessory.
sentences.chinese: 别不把吉他当回事，以为那是件时尚饰品。

sentences.english: Some other students, however, don’t take sex and relationships seriously.
sentences.chinese: 然而，另一些学生并不怎么拿性和恋爱关系当回事。

definition: to care about/to take seriously/to take to heart
to pay attention to/to care about/to attach importance to
useless/regard as useless
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
from the start/absolutely/entirely/simply
to consider as/to take to be
lit. to treat (what sb says) as wind past your ear/fig. to completely disregard
to care about/equivalent of 在於|在于[zai4 yu2]
to care about/to mind
variant of 答理[da1 li5]
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
erhua variant of 壓根|压根[ya4 gen1]
carefully/meticulously/to set one's heart on sth
(old) to report to one's master
to offend
to put on airs/to assume great airs
